item.title: The mystery of the millennium, revealing the secret of the birth of the eighteen thousand blacksmiths ‘Hapcheon Blacksmith Theme Park’ - Hapcheon-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea
item.description:
Daejanggyeong Theme Park Entrance

The mystery of the millennium, revealing the secret of the birth of the eighteen thousand blacksmiths ‘Hapcheon Blacksmith Theme Park’

Hapcheon-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea

The Tripitaka Koreana is considered as one of the greatest relics throughout Korea's history, or even Korea's history. Although there are about 20 species of blacksmith in the world, the eighteen thousand blacksmiths are listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in June 2007 due to their high accuracy and completeness. What is so great about the eighteen thousand colonel? The place where you can see with your eyes, touch with your hands, and dig into the excellence of the blacksmith is the theme park. The entire process, from the production motives, processes, and storage of the eighteen thousand blacksmiths, can be systematically known, which not only helps children experience learning, but also allows adults to feel the mystery of the blacksmiths once again.

The Blacksmith Theme Park is, as its name suggests, the theme of the eighteen thousand blacksmiths. I know only that the country and the people suffering from the Mongol invasion were made to save by the power of the Buddha, but the deeper and more mysterious the world, the closer it is to the world of the Blacksmith.

The first floor of the blacksmith exhibition room
After passing through the theme park entrance and passing through the neatly formed square and park, you will reach Daejanggyeong Millennium Hall, the main exhibition space. The circular exhibition hall on the first floor, which penetrates to the ceiling, is filled with hardwood plates. The fact is that the image of Haeinsa Jang Kyung Panjeon is reflected on the wall. Also displayed is the Dongpan Blacksmith, which was produced to permanently preserve the Palmman Blacksmith, a wooden board.
The appearance of the coppersmith

On the second floor, there are the Blacksmith Road Room, Mystery Room, Conservation Science Room, and Understanding Room. The Blacksmith Road Room introduces the process of recording and disseminating the Blacksmith.

One of the Buddha's teachings in the Blacksmithing
The video shows the process of making the eighteen thousand blacksmith, so children can easily understand it.
Video about making a blacksmith

The most impressive exhibition hall is the Mysterious Hall of the Blacksmith. It is a place that vividly shows the scene of scientific blacksmithing records close to mystery. It is necessary to go through a number of processes before completing the play.

A child watching the blacksmithing process
distant...
The process of writing letters on the hard plate
Daejanggyeong Mystery Room shows all these processes in an easy-to-understand way. In addition, there is a space where you can find out about the eighteen thousand colonoscopes through numbers. For example, the total length of the eight thousand and eighteen thousand pieces is 8,1,258, and a single plate is 70 cm wide, 24 cm long, and 2.8 cm thick, stacked in a row, 508 m higher than Baekdusan. The translation work took a total of 36 years, the gross weight of the plate was about 280 tons, 108 pillars in the Jangyeong Panjeon, and 0 of the corroded plates in the large colon ... . It expresses the greatness of the blacksmith who was vaguely known in numbers, so it easily touches the skin.
Blacksmith in numbers
In addition to the eighteen thousand colonel, the Jangkyung Panjeon, which stores the plates, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Preservation Science Lab reveals the principles of science hidden in the Jang Kyeong Pan. You can check the location of Jangyeongpanjeon, considering the altitude of the sun, the size and location of the window that facilitates ventilation, and the soil with charcoal, sashimi, salt and sand on the floor to control humidity and prevent pests.
A video showing the hidden science principles of Jang Kyung Panjeon

In the understanding room, you can sit in a comfortable chair to listen to the blacksmith, sand experience, and wish ribbon hanging.

Experience writing wishes on a ribbon
If you go down to the first floor again, the experience zone will appear. In addition to the human experience, you can freely experience the process of chemical engineering, wood carving, and family writing.
Chemical experience
The experience of people's experience is particularly impressive, but it is a process of engraving the plate and checking whether there are any wrong characters.
Experience

Daejanggyeong Theme Park is not completed, but is still being created. Construction is also underway around the square and entrance located in front of the Millennium Hall. This is due to the preparation for the Daejanggyeong World Culture Festival, which will take place from September 27th to November 10th. When the festival starts, there will be more to see, enjoy, and experience.

Daejanggyeong Millennium Hall
Gayasan Sori-gil starts right in front of Jangkyung Theme Park. On the other side of the road, the parking lot of Sorigil was wide, and when you cross the bridge, you can see a standing sign that announces the beginning of Sorigil. From here to Yeongsan Bridge in front of Haeinsa Temple, it is about 6km in length from Gayasan Sorigil. It is a pleasant way to walk along the forest path along the Hongryu-dong Valley, listening to the sound of water, birds, and wind.
Tree scenery at the theme park

The road is flat, so there is no burden on walking, and there are information boards explaining the nature, history, and culture of Mt. To learn more, you can use the Gayasan Sorigil commentary program. Following the trip of Hongryu-dong and the footsteps of Goun Choi Chi-won, he is conducting three programs: finding the hidden secrets of Hongryu-dong valley. The commentary program is on the National Park website www.knps.or.kr )

You can make a reservation by calling (Gayasan National Park Office 055-930-8000, 055-930-8003).

Daejanggyeong World Culture Festival Sculpture
The 0.6km section from Gilsangam to 6 Bridges in Sorigil is easily accessible to wheelchairs and strollers. Some slopes are steep, but there is no difficulty in using them because the decks are connected without stairs.
Gayasan Sori-gil along the valley
Especially in this section, there are many unexplored places such as Nakhwadam, Cheopseokdae, and Conservatory, which are the beauty of Hongryu-dong.
Sound path that is accessible to the disabled
You can't come here and go back without seeing Haeinsa Temple. Haeinsa Temple, which possesses the eighteen thousand colonel, is one of the three treasures in Korea, along with Tongdosa Temple, and Songkwangsa Temple, the Buddhist temple. Founded in the 3rd year of King Silla (802), its history is over a thousand years old. On the outer wall of the main hall, Daejeokjeon, there is a mural depicting the story of Haeinsa Temple.
View of Haeinsa Temple
Jangyeongpanjeon, which is located at a level higher than the Daejeokwangjeon, originally revealed the interior, but as soon as I climbed the stairs due to the successive temple fire and Sungnyemun fire, I made it go through the sideways road.
View of Haeinsa Temple
Unfortunately, you can take a glimpse of the shrine through the grate of the Sudarajang where the shrine was stored. Photographing is also prohibited, and you should be satisfied with taking a commemorative photo in front of the signboard that took the picture inside the Jang Kyeong Panjeon.
Stairs to climb
Admission is limited until 2016, so visitors inside are bound to pledge after that. It is so comforting to see the Jang Kyung Panjeon and the eighteen thousand major Jangkyung in three dimensions at the Daejanggyeong Theme Park.
Photo zone next to Jangkyung Panjeon

Hapcheon Healing Trip

Hapcheon-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea

Hapcheon has a quiet but beautiful scenery. Headed by the Haeinsa Temple at the foot of Gayasan, he prepared a healing trip to soothe the mind and body, focusing on Odosan Sunrise, Hapcheon Film Theme Park and Samga Hanwoo Street.
This line starts at Gayasan and Haeinsa, which are located in the northernmost part of Hapcheon, and meets one by one as it goes down to the south.

What kind of locality is it? Hapcheon means “narrow mine”. If you read Chinese characters literally, it is Hyecheon. There are many mountains and no fields. The narrow valley surrounded by mountains is named after many topographical features. However, in March 1914, when the administrative district was reorganized, it was said that the sum of the three villages was combined as the basins of Chogye and Samga were incorporated into Hapcheon-gun. From then on, the Chinese characters were used as is, but the pronunciation was '합천'.

Along the Haeinsa Temple
Let's go from Mount Kaya (1430m), the northern gateway to Hapcheon. Gayasan is located on the border between Gyeongnam and Gyeongbuk. Gyeongnam Hapcheon reaches south and Seongju County Gyeongbuk reaches north. The highest name in the region where the gaya was located was called ‘Gayasan’. It was designated National Park No. 9 in 1972.
Road to Gayasan Haeinsa Temple
If you enter the foothills of Gayasan along the winding road, you first reach Haeinsa Temple. Haeinsa Temple, which has the eighty-four grandfather, is considered one of Sambo temples in Korea along with Tongdosa in Yangsan and Songgwangsa in Suncheon.

If you want to taste Korean beef in Hapcheon, you should go to Samga-myeon in the south. There is a big market place where there are meat houses around. Even now, more than a dozen Korean cattle houses are gathered. You can taste fresh Korean beef for 20,000 won per serving (200g). If you're a vegetarian, keep in mind the wild vegetables located throughout the Gaya Mountains and Hapcheon. As it is a deep mountain valley, various mountain vegetables have been developed.
